p: Usually, extraction of C. asiatica is done for its phenolic and flavonoid compounds. A wide range of technologies has been used until now to yield a high-quality extract of C. asiatica at moderate cost and with a shorter extraction time. Selection of the extraction technique depends on the economic feasibility and suitability of the process for the target compounds. Since the amount of bioactive compounds in C. asiatica are relatively small, the extraction method must be chosen carefully to obtain the desired compound from the herb.
